meanings.definition: Pretentious or hypocritical show or ceremony
meanings.sent1: The mummery of the extravagant party impressed the guests.
meanings.sent2: The theater performance was filled with mummery and grand gestures.
meanings.sent3: The mummery of the magician's tricks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a mummery hiding the sadness within.
meanings.sent5: The mummery of the royal court was like a colorful mask over reality.

meanings.sent1: The children's play was a delightful mummery of pirates and treasure hunts.
meanings.sent2: The street performer's mummery attracted a small crowd.
meanings.sent3: The mummery of the clown made the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His excuses were just a mummery to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The mummery of the puppet show enchanted the young audience.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in pretentious or hypocritical behavior
meanings.sent1: Her constant mummery of kindness fooled no one.
meanings.sent2: The politician's mummery of concern for the people was transparent.
meanings.sent3: The mummery of pretending to like the awful dish was hard to keep up.
meanings.sent4: His mummery of friendship was revealed when he betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent5: The mummery of pretending to be busy was his way of avoiding work.
